ratings.comment: Lectures are logical, fluent, and straightforward for the most part. Learning/study objectives made very clear. Provides lecture pwrpoints with synched audio from the actual lecture. So, you can watch a lecture on your own time. These are the only necessary study resource. Text is a good resource. 3 MC exams, 2 probsets. Prof takes questions well

Take this class. just need to find a group of people to work with to do practice exams and problem sets and the class isn't bad at all. lectures and slides are posted online so don't need to go to class.

Judith has clear lectures with many diagrams to explain complicated concepts- obviously has mastered what works best to teach the material.  Gives last semester exam questions out to study and uses almost identical questions on your exams. Doesn't curve the class only because the averages are mid 90s on everything. Best professor I've had yet.

Professor Manning is an absolutely phenomenal teacher. One of the nicest ladies you will ever meet. She has a keen interest in her students success and will do almost anything to ensure that you are successful in her class. She always has a smile on her face and call tell a pretty good story. Overall, one of the greatest profs at the UW!

Prof. Manning is great, lectures are clear, material is not too difficult, but the single greatest thing Prof. Manning does is post her lectures complete with audio online for you to use. I studied completely by re-"attending" each lecture and did very well. It is the single greatest tool any professor can use to help their students.

I love her! She makes immunology very interesting and podcasts her lectures. Relistening to them helps with the problem sets and exams. Don't need to read the book because she already tells you everything you need to know in lecture, and sometimes she disagrees with the book.  Would highly recommend!

Exams were not bad, be sure to read through past exams because they are almost one and the same.  She is a great prof, however I often found myself dozing off during lectures because her voice is very slow and monotonous.  She also provides pp slides online with voice so you don't even have to go to lecture.

make sure to do all of the practice problems and questions that she has posted from previous exams, she reuses A LOT   of the same questions year after year. and make sure to review the quizes too since those questions will most likely be on the final also. really interesting class and a really good professor.
Great professor!  Does an excellent job explaining topics, also posts lectures online as well as an audio of her lectures on line.  Hilarious at times.  Highly reccomend her class.
I nice older women, who is rather dorky at times!
Interesting class, couldn't stand lectures.  She...talks...so...slow...sometimes.  Posts lectures online after class which was nice, never had to actually go to class.
Great class taught by great professor!  Very interesting and easy to understand!

Great Prof..her lecture power points are easy to follow and understand, she explains everything coherently, and she has her power points and recordings of her lectures online the next day.  Plus the class is pretty cool. and she's easy to get a hold of if need be.

Class is easy and designed nicely. Her honors section though...if you have honors you will have discussion sections with her and she tends to be difficult then. If she asks a question and someone answers it (correctly), she will act like its wrong and wai
